content:
Quote-replying from "Patient Hackers," just to keep it spotlighted. From @Ricky Bloomfield :

Dave deBronkart Rien Wertheim FYI, we will be holding an interactive session at DevDays to review the Health Records API on iOS. We’ll have engineers there (including Pascal Pfiffner!!) who can help you realize your patient empowerment dreams.

It would totally be possible for someone to implement something “on the spot” if they so desired and have some iOS experience. Would also love to see that happen.

Dare we fantasize about some sort of app challenge, with some nominal-yet-exciting F-Prize? (That's an X-Prize but in FHIR) (<<$1million X-Prizes)
I bet @Rien Wertheim has some great prize ideas! ;)

I bet Rien Wertheim has some great prize ideas! ;)

Well, we have the Startup Track for app developers with amazing ideas. https://www.devdays.com/us/startup-track/. Still figuring the prize details with HL7.
Bumping this short April 9 thread back to the top, germane to today's "roll call" for patient apps. @Rien Wertheim @Grahame Grieve @Ricky Bloomfield @Josh Mandel
